00020 /** \file
00021  \brief OBD GPS KML main entrypoint
00022  */
00023 #include <stdio.h>
00024 #include <stdlib.h>
00025 #include <string.h>
00026 #include <errno.h>
00027 
00028 #include "obdconfig.h"
00029 #include "obdgpskml.h"
00030 #include "justgps.h"
00031 #include "singleheight.h"
00032 #include "heightandcolor.h"
00033 
00034 #include "sqlite3.h"
00035 
00036 /// If the user wants progress
00037 static int show_progress;
00038 
00039 /// Check for the trip columns
00040 /** \return 0 for success, -1 for invalid */
00041 static int checktripcolumns(sqlite3 *db);
00042 
00043 /// Check for speed colum in gps table
00044 /** \return 0 for success, -1 for invalid */
00045 static int checkgps_speedtime(sqlite3 *db);
00046 
00047 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
00048 
00049     /// Output file
00050     FILE *outfile;
00051 
00052     /// Database to dump
00053     sqlite3 *db;
00054 
00055     /// outfile filename
00056     char *outfilename = NULL;
00057 
00058     /// Database file to open
00059     char *databasename = NULL;
00060 
00061     /// Name for kml folder
00062     char *kmlfoldername = NULL;
00063 
00064     /// Max altitiude to chart to
00065     int maxaltitude = DEFAULT_MAXALTITUDE;
00066 
00067     /// getopt's current option
00068     int optc;
00069 
00070     /// might get set during option parsing. Exit when done parsing
00071     int mustexit = 0;
00072 
00073     while ((optc = getopt_long (argc, argv, kmlshortopts, kmllongopts, NULL)) != -1) {
00074         switch (optc) {
00075             case 'h':
00076                 kmlprinthelp(argv[0]);
00077                 mustexit = 1;
00078                 break;
00079             case 'v':
00080                 kmlprintversion();
00081                 mustexit = 1;
00082                 break;
00083             case 'p':
00084                 show_progress = 1;
00085                 break;
00086             case 'd':
00087                 if(NULL != databasename) {
00088                     free(databasename);
00089                 }
00090                 databasename = strdup(optarg);
00091                 break;
00092             case 'o':
00093                 if(NULL != outfilename) {
00094                     free(outfilename);
00095                 }
00096                 outfilename = strdup(optarg);
00097                 break;
00098             case 'n':
00099                 if(NULL != kmlfoldername) {
00100                     free(kmlfoldername);
00101                 }
00102                 kmlfoldername = strdup(optarg);
00103                 break;
00104             case 'a':
00105                 maxaltitude = atoi(optarg);
00106                 break;
00107             default:
00108                 kmlprinthelp(argv[0]);
00109                 mustexit = 1;
00110                 break;
00111         }
00112     }
00113     if(mustexit) exit(0);
00114 
00115     if(NULL == databasename) {
00116         databasename = OBD_DEFAULT_DATABASE;
00117     }
00118 
00119     if(NULL == outfilename) {
00120         outfilename = DEFAULT_OUTFILENAME;
00121     }
00122 
00123     if(NULL == kmlfoldername) {
00124         kmlfoldername = DEFAULT_KMLFOLDERNAME;
00125     }
00126 
00127 
00128     // sqlite return status
00129     int rc;
00130     rc = sqlite3_open_v2(databasename, &db, SQLITE_OPEN_READONLY, NULL);
00131     if( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00132         fprintf(stderr, "Can't open database %s: %s\n", databasename, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00133         sqlite3_close(db);
00134         exit(1);
00135     }
00136 
00137     if(0 != checktripcolumns(db)) {
00138         fprintf(stderr, "Error with trip columns. Exiting\n");
00139         sqlite3_close(db);
00140         exit(1);
00141     }
00142 
00143     outfile = fopen(outfilename, "w");
00144     if(NULL == outfile) {
00145         perror(outfilename);
00146         exit(1);
00147     }
00148 
00149     fprintf(outfile, "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n"
00150         "<kml xmlns=\"http://www.opengis.net/kml/2.2\">\n"
00151         "<Folder>\n"
00152         "<name>%s</name>\n"
00153         "<description>OBD GPS Logger [http://icculus.org/obdgpslogger] was used to log a car journey and export this kml file</description>\n",
00154         kmlfoldername);
00155 
00156     writekmlgraphs(db,outfile,maxaltitude);
00157 
00158 
00159     fprintf(outfile,"</Folder>\n</kml>\n\n");
00160 
00161     fclose(outfile);
00162     sqlite3_close(db);
00163 
00164     return 0;
00165 }
00166 
00167 void writekmlgraphs(sqlite3 *db, FILE *f, int maxaltitude) {
00168     // Before entering this function, you should have written all the xml fluff
00169     //  that comes at the top of the kml file, and be ready to dump the other fluff afterwards
00170     
00171     sqlite3_stmt *trip_stmt;
00172     char select_trip_sql[] =
00173         "SELECT trip.tripid AS tripid,trip.start AS start,trip.end AS end "
00174         ",COUNT(trip.tripid) AS gpscount "
00175         "FROM trip LEFT JOIN gps ON trip.tripid=gps.trip "
00176         "GROUP BY trip.tripid "
00177         "ORDER BY trip.tripid";
00178     int rc;
00179     const char *dbend;
00180 
00181     // Cheesy progress
00182     if(show_progress) {
00183         printf("5.0\n");
00184         fflush(stdout);
00185     }
00186 
00187     rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, select_trip_sql, -1, &trip_stmt, &dbend);
00188     if(rc != SQLITE_OK) {
00189         fprintf(stderr,"SQL Error in trip select(%i): %s\n", rc, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00190         return;
00191     }
00192 
00193     sqlite3_reset(trip_stmt);
00194 
00195     if(0 == checkgps_speedtime(db)) {
00196         fprintf(f,"<Folder>\n"
00197             "<name>Speed and Position [Just GPS]</name>\n"
00198             "<description>Height == speed</description>\n");
00199         while(SQLITE_ROW == (rc = sqlite3_step(trip_stmt))) {
00200             if(2 > sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 3)) {
00201                 printf("Warning: Trip %i doesn't have gps\n", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00202             } else {
00203                 char graphname[64];
00204                 snprintf(graphname, sizeof(graphname), "Trip #%i", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00205     
00206                 fprintf(stderr, "Writing justgps %s\n", graphname);
00207     
00208                 gpsposvel(db,f, maxaltitude, 0,
00209                     sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 1), sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 2),
00210                     sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00211             }
00212         }
00213         if(rc != SQLITE_ROW && rc != SQLITE_DONE && rc != SQLITE_OK) {
00214             fprintf(stderr, "Error stepping database statement (%i):\n\t%s\n", rc,
00215                 sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00216         }
00217         fprintf(f, "</Folder>\n");
00218 
00219         sqlite3_reset(trip_stmt);
00220     } else {
00221         fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't find speed column in gps table. Not rendering justgps data\n");
00222     }
00223 
00224     fprintf(f,"<Folder>\n"
00225         "<name>RPM and Position</name>\n"
00226         "<description>Height indicates engine revs</description>\n");
00227     // Do a simple RPM vs position one first:
00228     while(SQLITE_ROW == (rc = sqlite3_step(trip_stmt))) {
00229         if(2 > sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 3)) {
00230             printf("Warning: Trip %i doesn't have gps\n", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00231         } else {
00232             char graphname[64];
00233             snprintf(graphname, sizeof(graphname), "Trip #%i", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00234 
00235             fprintf(stderr, "Writing RPM %s\n", graphname);
00236 
00237             kmlvalueheight(db,f, graphname, "", "rpm", maxaltitude, 0,
00238                 sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 1), sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 2),
00239                 sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00240         }
00241     }
00242     if(rc != SQLITE_ROW && rc != SQLITE_DONE && rc != SQLITE_OK) {
00243         fprintf(stderr, "Error stepping database statement (%i):\n\t%s\n", rc,
00244             sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00245     }
00246     fprintf(f, "</Folder>\n");
00247 
00248     sqlite3_reset(trip_stmt);
00249 
00250     if(show_progress) {
00251         printf("33.0\n");
00252         fflush(stdout);
00253     }
00254 
00255     fprintf(f,"<Folder>\n"
00256         "<name>MPG [via MAP], Speed and Position</name>\n"
00257         "<description>Height indicates speed, color indicates mpg [green == better]</description>\n");
00258     while(SQLITE_ROW == (rc = sqlite3_step(trip_stmt))) {
00259         if(2 > sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 3)) {
00260             printf("Warning: Trip %i doesn't have gps\n", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00261         } else {
00262             char graphname[64];
00263             snprintf(graphname, sizeof(graphname), "Trip #%i", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00264 
00265             fprintf(stderr, "Writing MAP-MPG,Speed %s\n", graphname);
00266 
00267             kmlvalueheightcolor(db,f,graphname, "",
00268                 "vss",maxaltitude, "(710.7*vss/(rpm*(map/iat)))", 5, 1,
00269                 sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 1), sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 2),
00270                 sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt,0));
00271         }
00272     }
00273     if(rc != SQLITE_ROW && rc != SQLITE_DONE && rc != SQLITE_OK) {
00274         fprintf(stderr, "Error stepping database statement (%i):\n\t%s\n", rc,
00275             sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00276     }
00277     fprintf(f, "</Folder>\n");
00278 
00279     fprintf(f,"<Folder>\n"
00280         "<name>MPG [via MAF], Speed and Position</name>\n"
00281         "<description>Height indicates speed, color indicates mpg [green == better]</description>\n");
00282     while(SQLITE_ROW == (rc = sqlite3_step(trip_stmt))) {
00283         if(2 > sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 3)) {
00284             printf("Warning: Trip %i doesn't have gps\n", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00285         } else {
00286             char graphname[64];
00287             snprintf(graphname, sizeof(graphname), "Trip #%i", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00288 
00289             fprintf(stderr, "Writing MAF-MPG,Speed %s\n", graphname);
00290 
00291             kmlvalueheightcolor(db,f,graphname, "",
00292                 "vss",maxaltitude, "(710.7*vss/maf)", 5, 1,
00293                 sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 1), sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 2),
00294                 sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt,0));
00295         }
00296     }
00297     if(rc != SQLITE_ROW && rc != SQLITE_DONE && rc != SQLITE_OK) {
00298         fprintf(stderr, "Error stepping database statement (%i):\n\t%s\n", rc,
00299             sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00300     }
00301     fprintf(f, "</Folder>\n");
00302 
00303     if(show_progress) {
00304         printf("66.0\n");
00305         fflush(stdout);
00306     }
00307 
00308     sqlite3_reset(trip_stmt);
00309     fprintf(f,"<Folder>\n"
00310         "<name>Gear and Position</name>\n"
00311         "<description>Height indicates ratio between rpm and speed. While you're in gear, a line should be flat</description>\n");
00312     while(SQLITE_ROW == (rc = sqlite3_step(trip_stmt))) {
00313         if(2 > sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 3)) {
00314             printf("Warning: Trip %i doesn't have gps\n", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00315         } else {
00316             char graphname[64];
00317             snprintf(graphname, sizeof(graphname), "Trip #%i", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00318 
00319             fprintf(stderr, "Writing Gear Ratio %s\n", graphname);
00320 
00321             kmlvalueheight(db,f, graphname, "", "(vss/rpm)", maxaltitude, 0,
00322                 sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 1), sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 2),
00323                 sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt,0));
00324         }
00325     }
00326     if(rc != SQLITE_ROW && rc != SQLITE_DONE && rc != SQLITE_OK) {
00327         fprintf(stderr, "Error stepping database statement (%i):\n\t%s\n", rc,
00328             sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00329     }
00330     fprintf(f, "</Folder>\n");
00331 
00332 
00333     sqlite3_reset(trip_stmt);
00334     fprintf(f,"<Folder>\n"
00335         "<name>Speed and Position (OBDII)</name>\n"
00336         "<description>Height indicates speed</description>\n");
00337     while(SQLITE_ROW == (rc = sqlite3_step(trip_stmt))) {
00338         if(2 > sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 3)) {
00339             printf("Warning: Trip %i doesn't have gps\n", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00340         } else {
00341             char graphname[64];
00342             snprintf(graphname, sizeof(graphname), "Trip #%i", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00343 
00344             fprintf(stderr, "Writing Speed OBDII %s\n", graphname);
00345 
00346             kmlvalueheight(db,f, graphname, "", "vss", maxaltitude, 0,
00347                 sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 1), sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 2),
00348                 sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt,0));
00349         }
00350     }
00351     if(rc != SQLITE_ROW && rc != SQLITE_DONE && rc != SQLITE_OK) {
00352         fprintf(stderr, "Error stepping database statement (%i):\n\t%s\n", rc,
00353             sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00354     }
00355     fprintf(f, "</Folder>\n");
00356 
00357 
00358     fprintf(f,"<Folder>\n"
00359         "<name>RPM, Speed and Position</name>\n"
00360         "<description>Height indicates speed, color indicates RPM</description>\n");
00361     while(SQLITE_ROW == (rc = sqlite3_step(trip_stmt))) {
00362         if(2 > sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 3)) {
00363             printf("Warning: Trip %i doesn't have gps\n", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00364         } else {
00365             char graphname[64];
00366             snprintf(graphname, sizeof(graphname), "Trip #%i", sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt, 0));
00367 
00368             fprintf(stderr, "Writing MPG,Speed %s\n", graphname);
00369 
00370             kmlvalueheightcolor(db,f,graphname, "",
00371                 "vss",maxaltitude, "rpm", 5, 0,
00372                 sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 1), sqlite3_column_double(trip_stmt, 2),
00373                 sqlite3_column_int(trip_stmt,0));
00374         }
00375     }
00376     if(rc != SQLITE_ROW && rc != SQLITE_DONE && rc != SQLITE_OK) {
00377         fprintf(stderr, "Error stepping database statement (%i):\n\t%s\n", rc,
00378             sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00379     }
00380     fprintf(f, "</Folder>\n");
00381 
00382 
00383     if(show_progress) {
00384         printf("100.0\n");
00385         fflush(stdout);
00386     }
00387 
00388     sqlite3_reset(trip_stmt);
00389 
00390 
00391     sqlite3_finalize(trip_stmt);
00392 }
00393 
00394 int checkgps_speedtime(sqlite3 *db) {
00395     char pragma_sql[] = "PRAGMA table_info(gps)";
00396 
00397     sqlite3_stmt *pragma_stmt;
00398     int rc;
00399 
00400     if(SQLITE_OK != (rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, pragma_sql, -1, &pragma_stmt, NULL))) {
00401         fprintf(stderr, "Error preparing stmt \"%s\" (%i): %s\n", pragma_sql, rc, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00402         return -1;
00403     }
00404 
00405     int found_speed = 0;
00406 
00407     while(SQLITE_ROW == sqlite3_step(pragma_stmt)) {
00408         if(0 == strcmp("speed", sqlite3_column_text(pragma_stmt, 1))) {
00409             found_speed = 1;
00410         }
00411     }
00412 
00413     sqlite3_finalize(pragma_stmt);
00414 
00415     if(found_speed) return 0;
00416 
00417     return -1;
00418 }
00419 
00420 static int checktripcolumns_internal(sqlite3 *db, const char *tablename) {
00421     char pragma_sql[512];
00422     snprintf(pragma_sql, sizeof(pragma_sql), "PRAGMA table_info(%s)", tablename);
00423 
00424     sqlite3_stmt *pragma_stmt;
00425     int rc;
00426 
00427     if(SQLITE_OK != (rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, pragma_sql, -1, &pragma_stmt, NULL))) {
00428         fprintf(stderr, "Error preparing stmt \"%s\" (%i): %s\n", pragma_sql, rc, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00429         return -1;
00430     }
00431 
00432     int found_trip = 0;
00433 
00434     while(SQLITE_ROW == sqlite3_step(pragma_stmt)) {
00435         if(0 == strcmp("trip", sqlite3_column_text(pragma_stmt, 1))) {
00436             found_trip = 1;
00437         }
00438     }
00439 
00440     sqlite3_finalize(pragma_stmt);
00441 
00442     if(found_trip) return 0;
00443 
00444     return -1;
00445 }
00446 
00447 static int checktripcolumns(sqlite3 *db) {
00448     int retvalue = 0;
00449     if(-1 == checktripcolumns_internal(db, "obd")) {
00450         fprintf(stderr, "trip column missing from obd table:\n  "
00451             "Please run obdlogrepair on this database\n");
00452         retvalue = -1;
00453     }
00454     if(-1 == checktripcolumns_internal(db, "gps")) {
00455         fprintf(stderr, "trip column missing from gps table:\n  "
00456             "Please run obdlogrepair on this database\n");
00457         retvalue = -1;
00458     }
00459     return retvalue;
00460 }
00461 
00462 void kmlprinthelp(const char *argv0) {
00463     printf("Usage: %s [params]\n"
00464         "   [-o|--out[=" DEFAULT_OUTFILENAME "]\n"
00465         "   [-d|--db[=" OBD_DEFAULT_DATABASE "]]\n"
00466         "   [-n|--name[=" DEFAULT_KMLFOLDERNAME "]]\n"
00467         "   [-a|--altitude[=%i]]\n"
00468         "   [-p|--progress]\n"
00469         "   [-v|--version] [-h|--help]\n", argv0, DEFAULT_MAXALTITUDE);
00470 }
00471 
00472 void kmlprintversion() {
00473     printf("Version: %i.%i\n", OBDGPSLOGGER_MAJOR_VERSION, OBDGPSLOGGER_MINOR_VERSION);
00474 }
